Geography Syllabus

Lesotho Secondary Education (2020 Edition)

1. Introduction

This syllabus is structured to provide learners with knowledge, skills, and attitudes in understanding geography within Lesotho, Africa, and globally. It supports sustainable development through environmental, social, and economic integration.

2. Aims

  • Develop understanding of geographical concepts.
  • Acquire practical geographical skills.
  • Relate geography to national development priorities.

3. Assessment Scheme

Paper 1: Short answers covering physical, economic, and population geography. Total 60 marks.

Paper 2: Essay-based questions. Total 100 marks.

4. Curriculum Sections

  • Section A: Physical Geography
  • Section B: Economic Activities
  • Section C: Settlement, Population and Migration
  • Section D: Basic Techniques and Inquiry Skills

5. Example Topics

Plate Tectonics: Types of landforms, earthquake distribution, effects on human activity.

Climate and Weather: Rainfall types, temperature influencers, global warming impacts.

Population Dynamics: Migration causes, age-sex pyramids, urban challenges.
